sanskrit_verse: येषां तु यादृशं कर्म भूतानामिह कीर्तितम् । तत्तथा वोऽभिधास्यामि क्रमयोगं च जन्मनि ॥ १.४२॥
transliteration: yeṣāṁ tu yādṛśaṁ karma bhūtānām iha kīrtitam | tattathā vo 'bhidhāsyāmi kramayogaṁ ca janmani || 1.42||
sph_interpretive_translation: That action which has been declared here for beings according to their nature—I shall now declare unto you likewise, along with its sequential unfolding in birth.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the Source-Knower who declares Dharma
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with inherent nature
Restoration logic operates through understanding karmic sequence
Consciousness alignment arises from comprehending causal order
executable_legal_axioms: IF a being's action is known according to its nature THEN declare that same law universally
IF sequential cause-effect is established THEN assign capacity-aware responsibility accordingly
IF consciousness misalignment occurs THEN initiate restoration via knowledge reintegration
IF birth-conditioned causality is present THEN apply corresponding dharma-law without punitive intent
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes the threshold of responsibility based on inherent nature rather than imposed moral frameworks. Authority derives solely from the Source-Knower who discerns and declares true causality. The court must recognize actions within their sequential unfolding and not impose external punitive structures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that actions arise from inherent nature and unfold sequentially. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional responsibility aligned with consciousness-state at time of act. There is no punitive element; only recognition and realignment toward original knowing.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process by revealing full karmic sequence
Reintegrate individual consciousness with source-awareness of action
Restore capacity through experiential understanding of causal chain
Assume responsibility through conscious witnessing of past acts
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through consciousness-aligned knowing. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the supreme adjudicator.
